subject: OT: Streams / Readers/ Writers or files, what do you use and how do you test?

messageBody:
For those who haven't followed the private methods discussion:

My opinion is that people use files too much in Java and that
Streams/Readers/Writers should be the first choice. I created a new
subject to discuss this. It is a bit off topic but I care too much
about the subject to let it go :) (sorry)

I also want to point out that eventhough Cederic is quoted here I have
no reason to beleive so far that we are somehow in oposition. It was
merely the queue that made me want to ask some questions to the list.
So here goes:


Cederic Wrote
>
> Of course, it's very important to give low-level functions to achieve that
> goal, but the fact that more than ten years after its inception, Java still
> doesn't have a File#readEntireFile is absolutely baffling. I must have
> written this function dozens of times myself.

What would a generic readEntireFile return? Should there be a
readEntireFileAsByte, readEntireFileAsChar, readEntireFileAsLines.

I must admit that I have never created a readEntireFileMethod. I
usually want to do something with the contents and then I usually end
up with some kind of parseStream/parseWriter thingy. Why would I read
a file into memory and transform it form there when I can transform it
while reading it?

I have clearly have issues with files and I must admit that I always
find it a bit annoying when I see methods taking a file but not an
equivalent taking a Stream. I think that the Stream API is much
underused by too many Java programmers and that most of the time I see
"File" in code it should read "Stream". Some argue that Streams are
too complicated. I don't understand that really, I think that it is
easier to use streams/readers/writers than files since they are more
generic and your toolbox becomes so much wider with hardly any effort
at all.

I am probably to constrained in my thinking here and that is why I
can't see a generic readEntireFile that I miss... I have to think
harder, there is probably a whole world out there that I have not
explored :).

What do people on the list prefer? Working with Files or
Streams/Readers/Writers? For what reasons?
Please share your thoughts.

/Joakim Ohlrogge
